page.title: 17Carlton Curlieu Houses
page.content: Carlton Curlieu Hall also known as the Manor House is one of the finest examples of 17th century architecture of its kind in the county. The house was originally built by the Bale family but has been owned by the Palmer family since 1661. The New Hall was built in the mid 60's by Sir Geoffrey Palmer. Manor Farm is a large 19th century farm house of red brick with extensive farm buildings. There are two cottages for farm workers. Hall Cottages are two 19th century farm cottages now made into one house and occupied by the Hall gardener. Home Farm is a large red brick Victorian house, no longer a farm house but privately owned by commuters to Leicester. Church Cottage is the oldest cottage in the village with stone foundations.
